capitalism.model

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • capitalism.model.Stock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @Entity
public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The persistent class for the stocks database table. It extends the Observable Class so it can provide base data for TableViews. TODO The additional functionality provided by the Observable Class is not used, but it probably should be.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Stock.OWNERTYPE
      Owners can be of two main types: industries, which produce things by employing labour and classes, which provide labour, and consume revenue.
      static class  Stock.Selector
      Readable constants to refer to the methods which provide information about the persistent members of the class
      static class  Stock.STOCKTYPE
      SQL type ENUM ('PRODUCTIVE_INPUT', 'CONSUMER_GOOD', 'SALES', 'MONEY') NOTE: here is a bug in H2 which prevents an enum type being used in a primary key; in consequence, the type of the persistent field 'stockType' is, confusingly, String and not StockType.
      static class  Stock.ValueExpression
      Fundamental.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock()
        Constructor for a Stock Entity. Also creates a 'hollow' primary key which must be consistently populated by the caller

      • Stock

        public Stock(Stock template)
        Make a carbon copy of the stock. At present, this is used to construct a comparator stock, so that changes can be highlighted ('differencing') in the display tables. It may have other uses, but I am not aware of them.
        Parameters:
        template - the stock from which to copy

    • Method Detail

      • getCommodity

        public Commodity getCommodity()
        the Commodity entity of this Stock
        Returns:
        the Commodity entity of this Stock

      • get

        public double get(Stock.ValueExpression a)
        generic selector which returns a numerical attribute depending on the Stock.ValueExpression
        Parameters:
        a - (QUANTITY, VALUE OR PRICE) selects whether to return the quantity, the value or the price of this stock
        Returns:
        the quantity if a=QUANTITY, etc.

      • wrappedString

        public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyStringWrapper wrappedString(Stock.Selector selector)
        provides a wrapped version of the selected member which the display will recognise, as a ReadOnlyStringWrapper. We don't mind the hardwiring because we don't really intend this code to be re-usable, it's not hard to modify, and it results in compact and readable usage code (@see for example TabbedTableViewer#makeProductiveStocksViewTable})
        Parameters:
        selector - chooses which member to evaluate
        Returns:
        a String representation of the members, formatted according to the relevant format string

      • changed

        public boolean changed(Stock.ValueExpression a)
        generic selector which returns a boolean depending on the Stock.ValueExpression
        Parameters:
        a - (QUANTITY, VALUE OR PRICE) selects whether to inspect the quantity, the value or the price of this stock
        Returns:
        true if the selected attribute is different from the corresponding attribute of the comparator stock.

      • changed

        public boolean changed(Stock.Selector selector)
        informs the display whether the selected member of this entity has changed, compared with the 'comparator' Stock which normally comes from a different timeStamp. We don't mind the hardwiring because we don't really intend this code to be re-usable, it's not hard to modify, and it results in compact and readable usage code for example (@see TabbedTableViewer#makeSalesStocksViewTable})
        Parameters:
        selector - chooses which member to evaluate
        Returns:
        whether this member has changed or not. False if selector is unavailable here

      • showDelta

        public java.lang.String showDelta(java.lang.String item,
                                  Stock.ValueExpression valueExpression)
        If the selected field has changed, return the difference between the current value and the former value
        Parameters:
        item - the original item - returned as the result if there is no change
        valueExpression - selects the display attribute where relevant (QUANTITY, VALUE, PRICE)
        Returns:
        the original item if nothing has changed, otherwise the change, as an appropriately formatted string

      • chooseComparison

        private void chooseComparison()
        chooses the comparator depending on the state set in the ViewManager.comparatorToggle radio buttons

      • stocksByStockTypeObservable

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Stock> stocksByStockTypeObservable(java.lang.String stockType)
        an observable list of stocks of a particular stock type, for display by ViewManager, at the current project and timeStampDisplayCursor. timeStampDisplayCursor, which may diverge from timeStamp, identifies the row that the user last clicked on.
        Parameters:
        stockType - the stockType (Productive, Sales, Consumption, Money) of this stock
        Returns:
        an observableList of stocks

      • reCalculateStockTotalValuesAndPrices

        public void reCalculateStockTotalValuesAndPrices()
        When the unit price or the unit value of a commodity changes, the price and value of each stock changes accordingly This method enacts the change.

      • modifyBy

        public void modifyBy(double extraQuantity)
        Change the size of the stock by quantity and adjust the value and price accordingly. Throw runtime error if the result would be less than zero
        Parameters:
        extraQuantity - the quantity to be added to the size of the stock (negative if subtracted)

      • modifyBy

        public void modifyBy(double quantity,
                     double valueAdded)
        overloaded version of changeBy which sets the value separately
        Parameters:
        quantity - the increase in size
        valueAdded - the increase in value

      • modifyTo

        public void modifyTo(double newQuantity)
        Set the size of the stock to the Quantity and adjust the value and price accordingly. Throw runtime error if the result would be less than zero
        Parameters:
        newQuantity - the quantity to be added to the size of the stock (negative if subtracted)

      • transferStock

        public void transferStock(Stock to,
                          double quantityTransferred)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Helper function transfers quantityTransferred from this Stock to toStock. Also transfers the value of the stock and the price. Carries out checks and throws an exception if conditions are violated
        Parameters:
        to - the stock that is gaining the value
        quantityTransferred - the amount to transfer
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • setComparators

        public static void setComparators(int timeStampID)
        set the comparators for all stock entities in the current project, for the given timeStampID
        Parameters:
        timeStampID - the timeStampID of the Stock entities whose comparators will be set

      • stockByPrimaryKey

        public static Stock stockByPrimaryKey(int project,
                                      int timeStamp,
                                      java.lang.String industry,
                                      java.lang.String commodity,
                                      java.lang.String stockType)
        get the single stock with the primary key given by all the parameters
        Parameters:
        project - the given project
        timeStamp - the given timeStamp
        industry - the name of the owning industry, as a String
        commodity - the name of the use value of this stock, as a String
        stockType - the type of this stock (money, productive, sales, consumption) as a String
        Returns:
        the single stock defined by this primary key, null if it does not exist

        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the given timeStammp
        industry - the Industry to which the stock belongs
        Returns:
        the single stock of money owned by the industry

      • consumptionByCommodityAndClassSingle

        public static Stock consumptionByCommodityAndClassSingle(int timeStamp,
                                                         java.lang.String socialClass,
                                                         java.lang.String commodity)
        the single stock of a consumer good of the given use value owned by the given social class, at the current project and a given timeStamp
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the given timeStamp
        socialClass - the socialClass that consumes these stocks
        commodity - the required use value
        Returns:
        the single consumption stocks of the given commodity that is owned by this social class

      • salesByCommodity

        public static java.util.List<Stock> salesByCommodity(int timeStamp,
                                                     java.lang.String commodity)
        a list of sales Stock of a given use value for the current project and a given timeStamp. NOTE only the industry will vary, and at present only one of these industries will produce this use value. However in general more than one industry may produce it so we yield a list here.
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the given timeStamp
        commodity - the use value that the sales stocks contain
        Returns:
        a list of the sales stocks that contain the given use value Note: there can be more than one seller of the same use value
